vtta-iconizer.icon-prefix.name: Icon prefix
vtta-iconizer.icon-prefix.hint: Specificy a prefix that is prepended in front of every found icon name. If you have your icons locally, the prefix can be the directory where you stored your icons. If you host your icons online, this can be the hostname of your server/ S3 bucket.
vtta-iconizer.replacement-policy.name: Icon replacement policy
vtta-iconizer.replacement-policy.hint: Defines if icons should be set automatically
vtta-iconizer.icon-database-policy.name: Icon database policy
vtta-iconizer.icon-database-policy.hint: Defines which databases should be used when deciding on the new icon. A custom database is a JSON-file in the icon directory named 'icons.json'. See vtta-iconizer/data/custom-example.json for an example format. Note: Changing this setting requires a reload.
vtta-iconizer.icon-database-policy.1: Use the predefined database and my custom one
vtta-iconizer.base-dictionary.name: Base dictionary
vtta-iconizer.base-dictionary.hint: Select the base dictionary to use, defaults to a dictionary referencing to the basic Foundry icons. Please note: This is only the dictionary, you will need to add the required icons manually. Note: Changing this setting requires a reload.
vtta-iconizer.share-missing-icons.name: Share missing icons
vtta-iconizer.share-missing-icons.hint: You can choose to send the item details (name, type and subtype) to the VTTA server. This enables me to find suitable icons for new items more easy.
